ground_truth: A policeman from inside the house is taking Nathan by the elbow, and as Nathan allows himself to be led back into the house, he calls back over his shoulder. We follow the two, hand-held, as the police lead Nathan toward the living room. The room is filled with policemen milling about in several different uniforms: local police, state troopers, and plainclothes detectives. The original policeman is leading Nathan to a table where a white-smocked technician is preparing an inkpad and exemplar sheets. The dialogue is urgent, rapid-fire, and overlapping. Byrum has taken Nathan's right hand and is rolling its fingers onto the inkpad, but Nathan jerks his hand away. Two men in conservative suits are approaching as Nathan gives his hand back and raises his voice at an offscreen bellower. Nathan is getting worked up and he grabs the overcoat being displayed by FBI #2. Nathan realizes that he's gotten ink from his fingerprinting all over the coat and furiously kicks it. Throughout the speech, Nathan stalks the room, working himself into a frenzy, furiously putting coffee cups onto coasters, generally cleaning up, hectoring the police, and swiping their feet off his furniture. Specifically, it is the hole in the muddy patch of earth that Gale and Evelle climbed out of. We are pulling back to reveal the feet—the shiny black patent leather shoes and blue pants cuffs—becoming quickly spattered—of several policemen milling about the hole, while German shepherds sniff around. With a roar, motorcycle wheels enter the frame, and the bike's jackbooted rider casually tools around the hole once; police step back, and dogs skitter away to give him room. He backs toward the camera and stops, standing astride the bike, while the whipcracking biker cue mixes up. The biker shakes his head; he doesn't think they went that way. Suddenly, with a loud whipcrack effect, the biker's head snaps to profile as he stares across the field, stock-still, having heard, smelled, or sensed something. The dogs milling around the hole also react, snapping to attention a split second after the biker, as a jackrabbit is bounding away at the far end of the field. After a moment, their attention returns to the hole, and his attention also returns to the matter at hand as he squints, concentrating. His bike rumbles. It is the bathroom where we earlier saw Gale and Evelle combing their hair, now empty. The bathroom is quiet except for the dripping sink and the faint rumble of an approaching motorcycle, which grows louder, then begins to recede as the bike shoots by the station. Suddenly, we hear the screech of the bike's brakes, and we are on the road outside the gas station as the motorcycle screeches to a halt in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A constable from inside the dwelling is taking Nathan by the arm, and as Nathan permits himself to be guided back into the dwelling, he calls back over his shoulder. We follow the pair, hand-held, as the officers lead Nathan toward the parlor. The chamber is filled with constables milling about in several different uniforms: municipal police, state officers, and plainclothes investigators. The original constable is guiding Nathan to a table where a white-smocked technician is preparing an inkpad and exemplar sheets. The dialogue is urgent, rapid-fire, and overlapping. Byrum has taken Nathan's right hand and is rolling its fingers onto the inkpad, but Nathan jerks his hand away. Two men in conservative suits are approaching as Nathan gives his hand back and raises his voice at an offscreen bellower. Nathan is getting worked up and he grabs the overcoat being shown by FBI #2. Nathan realizes that he's gotten ink from his fingerprinting all over the coat and furiously kicks it. Throughout the speech, Nathan prowls the chamber, working himself into a frenzy, furiously putting coffee cups onto coasters, generally tidying up, hectoring the officers, and swiping their feet off his furniture. Specifically, it is the hole in the muddy patch of soil that Gale and Evelle climbed out of. We are pulling back to reveal the feet—the shiny black patent leather shoes and blue trousers cuffs—becoming quickly spattered—of several constables milling about the hole, while German shepherds sniff around. With a roar, motorcycle wheels enter the frame, and the bike's jackbooted rider casually tools around the hole once; officers step back, and dogs skitter away to give him space. He backs toward the camera and halts, standing astride the bike, while the whipcracking biker cue mixes up. The biker shakes his head; he doesn't think they went that route. Suddenly, with a loud whipcrack effect, the biker's head snaps to profile as he gazes across the field, stock-still, having heard, smelled, or sensed something. The dogs milling around the hole also react, snapping to attention a split second after the biker, as a jackrabbit is bounding away at the far extremity of the field. After a moment, their attention returns to the hole, and his attention also returns to the issue at hand as he squints, concentrating. His bike rumbles. It is the restroom where we earlier saw Gale and Evelle combing their hair, now vacant. The restroom is quiet except for the dripping basin and the faint rumble of an approaching motorcycle, which grows louder, then begins to recede as the bike shoots by the station. Suddenly, we hear the screech of the bike's brakes, and we are on the road outside the gas station as the motorcycle screeches to a halt in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A policeman from inside the house is being taken by Nathan by the elbow, and as he allows himself to lead Nathan back into the house, Nathan calls back over his shoulder. We follow the two, hand-held, as Nathan is led toward the living room by the police. Policemen are milling about in several different uniforms in the room: local police, state troopers, and plainclothes detectives. Nathan is being led by the original policeman to a table where an inkpad and exemplar sheets are being prepared by a white-smocked technician. The dialogue is urgent, rapid-fire, and overlapping. Byrum has taken Nathan's right hand and is rolling its fingers onto the inkpad, but his hand is jerked away by Nathan. Two men in conservative suits are approaching as the hand is given back by Nathan and his voice is raised at an offscreen bellower. Nathan is getting worked up, and the overcoat being displayed by FBI #2 is grabbed by him. He realizes that ink from his fingerprinting has been gotten all over the coat by him and furiously kicks it. Throughout the speech, the room is stalked by Nathan, working himself into a frenzy, coffee cups are furiously put onto coasters, the police are hectored by him, and their feet are swiped off his furniture. Specifically, it is the hole in the muddy patch of earth that was climbed out of by Gale and Evelle. We are pulling back to reveal the shiny black patent leather shoes and blue pants cuffs—the feet becoming quickly spattered—of several policemen milling about the hole, while German shepherds are sniffing around. With a roar, motorcycle wheels are entering the frame, and the bike is tooled around the hole once by the jackbooted rider; police step back, and dogs skitter away to give him room. He backs toward the camera and stops, standing astride the bike, while the whipcracking biker cue is mixing up. He shakes his head; they didn't go that way according to him. Suddenly, with a loud whipcrack effect, the biker's head is snapped to profile by him as he stares across the field, stock-still, having heard, smelled, or sensed something. The dogs milling around the hole also react, snapping to attention a split second after he does, as a jackrabbit is bounding away at the far end of the field. After a moment, attention is returned to the hole by them, and his attention also returns to the matter at hand as he squints, concentrating. His bike rumbles. It is the bathroom, now empty, where we earlier saw Gale and Evelle combing their hair. The bathroom is quiet except for the dripping sink and the faint rumble of an approaching motorcycle, which is growing louder, then begins to recede as the station is shot by the bike. Suddenly, we hear the screech of the bike's brakes, and the motorcycle screeches to a halt in the foreground on the road outside the gas station.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A policeman inside the house takes Nathan by the elbow, leading him to the living room filled with various officers: local police, state troopers, and detectives. The policeman guides Nathan to a table where a technician prepares an inkpad. Byrum starts fingerprinting Nathan, who pulls his hand away, gets upset, and inadvertently smears ink on an overcoat held by FBI #2. Nathan furiously kicks the coat and paces the room, agitatedly tidying up and scolding officers. Nearby, policemen in shiny shoes and blue pants examine a hole in the muddy earth alongside German shepherds. A motorcycle rider arrives, circling the hole as police and dogs retreat. The rider halts, sensing something, as a jackrabbit appears, drawing brief attention. The scene shifts to a quiet bathroom where Gale and Evelle once were, with the sound of an approaching motorcycle growing louder, then receding. Suddenly, the bike's brakes screech, stopping outside a gas station.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A policeman inside the house leads Nathan, who calls back over his shoulder. We follow them as they head to the living room filled with policemen in various uniforms, including local police, state troopers, and plainclothes detectives. The original officer brings Nathan to a technician preparing an inkpad. During urgent, rapid dialogue, Byrum rolls Nathan's fingers on the inkpad, but Nathan jerks away. Two suited men approach as Nathan raises his voice. He grabs an overcoat, realizes it’s ink-stained, and furiously kicks it. Nathan stalks the room, agitated, cleaning, hectoring the police, and removing their feet from furniture. Meanwhile, at a hole nearby, policemen in shiny shoes and German shepherds mill around. A biker arrives, sending police and dogs back. He doesn't think they went that way. Suddenly, he senses something and focus shifts to a jackrabbit at the field's edge. Dogs and biker refocus on the hole. The bathroom, once occupied by Gale and Evelle, is now empty, with only a dripping sink and the faint sound of a motorcycle, which grows louder then fades as it passes a station. The bike screeches to a halt on the road outside.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A policeman, already positioned inside the house, is gently yet firmly taking hold of Nathan by the elbow. As Nathan compliantly allows himself to be guided back into the confines of the house, he turns his head to call back over his shoulder in a manner that suggests urgency. We follow these two figures closely, through the lens of a hand-held camera, as the law enforcement personnel guide Nathan with determination toward the bustling living room. This room is alive with activity, occupied by policemen milling about in a variety of uniforms that signify their roles: local police officers, state troopers, and plainclothes detectives are all present. The policeman who initially took hold of Nathan is earnestly leading him toward a table where a technician, dressed in a pristine white smock, is methodically preparing an inkpad and exemplar sheets for the task at hand. Their dialogue is charged with urgency, rapid and overlapping in nature. Byrum, with a steady hand, has taken Nathan's right hand, skillfully rolling its fingers onto the inkpad, but Nathan suddenly jerks his hand away in protest. At this moment, two men, dressed in conservative suits, are making their approach as Nathan reluctantly offers his hand back, raising his voice in response to an unseen person offscreen who is bellowing. Nathan, becoming increasingly agitated, grabs the overcoat being exhibited by FBI #2. In his agitation, Nathan realizes that ink from his fingerprinting session has smeared all over the coat, provoking him to furiously kick it in frustration. Throughout his tirade, Nathan is moving frenetically around the room, working himself into a heightened state of frenzy. He furiously places coffee cups onto coasters, tidies up with exaggerated motions, and hectors the police officers while swiping their feet off his furniture in a display of righteous indignation. The focus shifts to the hole in the muddy patch of earth—the very spot from which Gale and Evelle recently emerged. We begin to pull back, revealing the shiny black patent leather shoes and the blue pants cuffs of several policemen, quickly becoming spattered with mud as they mill about the hole, while German shepherds keenly sniff the surrounding area. Suddenly, there's a roar as motorcycle wheels come into view within the frame, with the bike's jackbooted rider casually circling around the perimeter of the hole once; police officers instinctively take a step back, and the dogs skitter away to allow him space. The rider slowly backs toward the camera and comes to a halt, standing astride the bike, while the whip-cracking biker cue plays up. The biker shakes his head slowly; his intuition suggests they didn't head in that direction. Abruptly, with an attention-commanding whipcrack effect, the biker's head snaps into a profile position as he gazes intently across the field, standing motionless, as if he has heard, smelled, or sensed something significant. The dogs who have been milling around the hole also suddenly react, snapping to attention just a split second after the biker, with their focus drawn to a jackrabbit bounding away swiftly at the far end of the expansive field. After a brief moment, their attention reverts back to the hole, and the biker re-engages with the matter at hand, squinting in concentration as his bike rumbles beneath him. The scene transitions to the bathroom where we previously observed Gale and Evelle meticulously combing through their hair, now fallen silent and devoid of occupants. The bathroom is hushed, save for the occasional dripping from the sink and the faint rumble of a motorcycle approaching, growing louder before receding as the bike speeds past the station. Suddenly, the screech of the bike's brakes pierces the air, and we find ourselves positioned on the road outside the gas station, where the motorcycle squeals to an abrupt stop in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Inside the house, a policeman is already positioned and is gently yet firmly grasping Nathan by the elbow, guiding him with a sense of determined caution. Nathan, without resistance, allows himself to be led back into the confines of the house, but as he turns his head, he calls back over his shoulder with an urgency that cannot be ignored. We closely follow the two figures, capturing them through the lens of a hand-held camera. The law enforcement personnel advance with Nathan, guiding him with a strong sense of purpose toward the lively, bustling living room. This room is a hive of activity, filled with policemen moving around in a variety of uniforms that signify their distinct roles: local police officers, state troopers, and plainclothes detectives are all represented. The policeman, who initially took hold of Nathan, is earnestly leading him toward a table where a technician, dressed meticulously in a pristine white smock, is methodically setting up an inkpad and exemplar sheets, preparing for the important task at hand. Their dialogue is charged with intensity, rapid and overlapping in nature. Byrum, with a steady and practiced hand, takes Nathan's right hand, skillfully rolling its fingers onto the inkpad. However, Nathan suddenly snaps his hand away in defiance. At this critical moment, two men, dressed in conservative suits, approach as Nathan reluctantly extends his hand back again, raising his voice in response to an unseen person offscreen who is shouting. As agitation grows, Nathan clutches at an overcoat being displayed by FBI #2. In his heightened state of agitation, Nathan becomes aware that ink from his fingerprinting session has smeared all over the coat, provoking him to angrily kick it in a burst of frustration. Throughout his tirade, Nathan is moving frenetically around the room, increasing his state of frenzy. He furiously places coffee cups onto coasters, tidies with exaggerated motions, and hectors the police officers, swiping their feet off his furniture in a display of righteous indignation. The focus shifts to the hole in the muddy patch of earth—the very spot from which Gale and Evelle recently emerged. As we begin to pull back, the scene reveals several policemen's shiny black patent leather shoes and blue pants cuffs, quickly becoming spattered with mud as they continue to mill about the hole. Meanwhile, German shepherds keenly sniff the surrounding area with focused intent. Suddenly, there's a roar as motorcycle wheels come into view, the bike's jackbooted rider casually circling around the perimeter of the hole once; instinctively, police officers take a step back, and the dogs skitter away to give him space. The rider slowly backs toward the camera, coming to a steadfast halt, standing astride his bike with an air of authority, while the whip-cracking biker cue underscores his presence. The biker shakes his head slowly; his intuition whispers that they didn't head in that direction. Abruptly, with a commanding whipcrack effect, the biker's head snaps into a profile position as he gazes intently across the field, standing motionless, as if sensing something significant. The dogs, milling around the hole, react almost in unison, snapping to attention just a split second after the biker, their focus drawn to a jackrabbit bounding swiftly at the far end of the expansive field. After a brief instant, their attention reverts back to the hole, and the biker refocuses on the matter at hand, squinting in concentration as his bike rumbles beneath him. The scene transitions quietly to the bathroom where we previously observed Gale and Evelle meticulously combing through their hair; now, it is silent and vacant, the bathroom hushed except for the occasional dripping from the sink and the faint rumble of a motorcycle approaching, growing louder before fading as the bike speeds past the station. Suddenly, the screech of the bike's brakes pierces the air, and we find ourselves positioned on the road outside the gas station, where the motorcycle skids to an abrupt stop in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Inside the house, a policeman securely holds Nathan by the elbow and gently guides him back inside, while Nathan complies with the movement and calls back over his shoulder to someone behind him. We seamlessly trail behind them with a hand-held view as Nathan follows the police toward the living room. The living room is bustling with activity, filled with a variety of policemen moving about in different uniforms, including local police officers, state troopers, and detectives dressed in plain clothes. The original policeman carefully navigates Nathan through the crowd to a table where a technician dressed in a white smock is diligently setting up an inkpad and exemplar sheets in preparation for fingerprinting. The air is filled with an urgent, rapid-fire dialogue that overlaps continuously. Byrum steps forward and confidently takes Nathan's right hand, methodically rolling each of Nathan's fingers onto the inkpad in a practiced motion, but Nathan abruptly jerks his hand away, interrupting the process. As two men in conservative suits approach, Nathan hesitantly offers his hand back for the fingerprinting and simultaneously raises his voice at someone shouting from off-screen. Becoming increasingly agitated, Nathan snatches an overcoat on display from FBI #2, only to realize that he has inadvertently smeared ink all over the coat, prompting him to furiously kick it in frustration. Nathan's agitation escalates as he paces around the room in a frenzy, energetically placing coffee cups onto coasters with deliberate precision, tidying up the space, vocally chastising the police, and insistently swiping their feet off of his furniture to assert his dominance. Meanwhile, the scene shifts to the muddy patch of earth nearby, where Gale and Evelle previously emerged from a hole. We pull back to reveal the feet of several policemen in shiny black patent leather shoes and blue pants cuffs, which quickly become spattered with mud as they mill around the hole, while German shepherds attentively sniff the area. With a sudden roar, the scene is interrupted by the entrance of motorcycle wheels into the frame, as the bike's rider, wearing jackboots, casually circles the hole once, prompting police to step back and dogs to skitter away, creating space for him. The biker then reverses toward the camera and stops, standing astride the bike as the sound of a whipcracking biker cue mixes up. The biker shakes his head, indicating his belief that the culprits did not head in the direction previously presumed. In an unexpected moment, accompanied by a loud whipcrack effect, the biker's head snaps to a side profile as he becomes intensely alert, staring across the field, having detected something through sound, smell, or other senses. The dogs milling around the hole react instantly, snapping to attention just after the biker, as their focus shifts to a jackrabbit bounding away at the far end of the field. After a brief pause, the attention of both the biker and the dogs returns to the hole as the biker squints, concentrating intently while the bike rumbles beneath him. We transition to the bathroom, once occupied by Gale and Evelle as they combed their hair, now standing empty and silent except for the gentle dripping of the sink and the faint rumble of an approaching motorcycle, which progressively grows louder and then gradually fades as the bike speeds past the station. Suddenly, the scene outside the gas station is shattered by the screeching brakes of the motorcycle, which brings it to a sudden halt in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A policeman guides Nathan back into the house, where they enter a bustling living room filled with various law enforcement officials. As Nathan is led to a table with a technician preparing fingerprint materials, he initially resists but then reluctantly complies. Amid a tense and overlapping dialogue, Nathan becomes agitated, grabbing an overcoat and smearing it with ink, then kicking it in frustration. He paces the room, expressing his agitation by tidying up and admonishing the police. Meanwhile, outside, police and dogs are investigating a muddy hole that Gale and Evelle previously emerged from. A motorcyclist circles the area, causing everyone to step back. Assessing the situation with sharp attention, he suddenly perceives something across the field, momentarily distracts the dogs, then refocuses on the investigation. As he stands by his bike, the scene shifts to a bathroom, once occupied by Gale and Evelle, now quiet except for a dripping sink. The sound of a motorcycle approaches, crescendos, and fades as it speeds past a gas station, then abruptly screeches to a stop on the road outside.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A policeman from inside the house, likely called to the scene due to a disturbance, is taking Nathan by the elbow, and as Nathan allows himself to be led back into the house, he calls back over his shoulder. We follow the two, hand-held, as the police, who appear to be conducting a thorough investigation, lead Nathan toward the living room. The room is filled with policemen milling about in several different uniforms: local police, often first responders in such cases, state troopers who provide regional law enforcement support, and plainclothes detectives specializing in investigative work. The original policeman is leading Nathan to a table where a white-smocked technician, probably from the forensic unit, is preparing an inkpad and exemplar sheets for fingerprinting. The dialogue is urgent, rapid-fire, and overlapping, indicative of the high tension typical in police operations. Byrum has taken Nathan's right hand and is rolling its fingers onto the inkpad used to capture fingerprints for identification, but Nathan jerks his hand away. Two men in conservative suits, likely FBI agents given their attire and demeanor, are approaching as Nathan gives his hand back and raises his voice at an offscreen bellower. Nathan is getting worked up and he grabs the overcoat being displayed by FBI #2, which is part of an evidence collection. Nathan realizes that he's gotten ink from his fingerprinting all over the coat and furiously kicks it. Throughout the speech, Nathan stalks the room, working himself into a frenzy, furiously putting coffee cups onto coasters; this behavior suggests he is consumed by stress, generally cleaning up, hectoring the police, and swiping their feet off his furniture. Specifically, it is the hole in the muddy patch of earth that Gale and Evelle climbed out of, reminiscent of a scene from a recent escape or clandestine activity. We are pulling back to reveal the feet—the shiny black patent leather shoes and blue pants cuffs—becoming quickly spattered—of several policemen milling about the hole, while German shepherds, trained for tracking and detection, sniff around. With a roar, motorcycle wheels enter the frame, and the bike's jackbooted rider, likely part of a special police unit for rapid response, casually tools around the hole once; police step back, and dogs skitter away to give him room. He backs toward the camera and stops, standing astride the bike, while the whipcracking biker cue, a sound effect used to dramatize sudden actions, mixes up. The biker shakes his head; he doesn't think they went that way. Suddenly, with a loud whipcrack effect, the biker's head snaps to profile as he stares across the field, stock-still, having heard, smelled, or sensed something indicating a clue. The dogs milling around the hole also react, snapping to attention a split second after the biker, as a jackrabbit is bounding away at the far end of the field, drawing momentary suspicion. After a moment, their attention returns to the hole, and his attention also returns to the matter at hand as he squints, concentrating. His bike rumbles, a sound underscoring the tension in the scene. It is the bathroom where we earlier saw Gale and Evelle combing their hair, now empty, indicative of their previous presence there before fleeing. The bathroom is quiet except for the dripping sink and the faint rumble of an approaching motorcycle, which grows louder, then begins to recede as the bike shoots by the station, indicating the presence of the motorcycle patrol. Suddenly, we hear the screech of the bike's brakes, and we are on the road outside the gas station as the motorcycle screeches to a halt in the foreground, stopping abruptly as if intercepting someone or something of interest.

During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. We are pulling back to reveal the feet—the shiny black patent leather shoes and blue pants cuffs—becoming quickly spattered—of several policemen milling about the hole while German shepherds sniff around. With a roar motorcycle wheels enter the frame and the bike's jackbooted rider casually tools around the hole once police step back and dogs skitter away to give him room. He backs toward the camera and stops standing astride the bike while the whipcracking biker cue mixes up. The biker shakes his head. he does not think they went that way. Suddenly with a loud whipcrack effect the biker's head snaps to profile as he stares across the field stockstill having heard smelled or sensed something. The dogs milling around the hole also react snapping to attention a split second after the biker as a jackrabbit is bounding away at the far end of the field. After a moment their attention returns to the hole and his attention also returns to the matter at hand as he squints concentrating. His bike rumbles. It is the bathroom where we earlier saw Gale and Evelle combing their hair now empty. The bathroom is quiet except for the dripping sink and the faint rumble of an approaching motorcycle which grows louder then begins to recede as the bike shoots by the station. Suddenly we hear the screech of the bike's brakes and we are on the road outside the gas station as the motorcycle screeches to a halt in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: A policeman from inside the house is taking Nathan by the elbow and as Nathan allows himself to be led back into the house he calls back over his shoulder. We follow the two handheld as the police lead Nathan toward the living room. The room is filled with policemen milling about in several different uniforms local police state troopers and plainclothes detectives. The original policeman is leading Nathan to a table where a whitesmocked technician is preparing an inkpad and exemplar sheets. The dialogue is urgent rapidfire and overlapping. Byrum has taken Nathan's right hand and is rolling its fingers onto the inkpad but Nathan jerks his hand away. The dogs milling around the hole also react snapping to attention a split second after the biker as a jackrabbit is bounding away at the far end of the field. After a moment their attention returns to the hole and his attention also returns to the matter at hand as he squints concentrating. His bike rumbles. It is the bathroom where we earlier saw Gale and Evelle combing their hair now empty. The bathroom is quiet except for the dripping sink and the faint rumble of an approaching motorcycle which grows louder then begins to recede as the bike shoots by the station. Suddenly we hear the screech of the bike's brakes and we are on the road outside the gas station as the motorcycle screeches to a halt in the foreground.

We follow the two handheld as the police lead Nathan toward the living room. It is the bathroom where we earlier saw Gale and Evelle combing their hair now empty. The bathroom is quiet except for the dripping sink and the faint rumble of an approaching motorcycle which grows louder then begins to recede as the bike shoots by the station. Suddenly we hear the screech of the bike's brakes and we are on the road outside the gas station as the motorcycle screeches to a halt in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A gardener from outside the barn is guiding Philip by the knee, and as Philip allows himself to be navigated back into the barn, he shouts back over his toes. We trail the duo, tripod-held, as the firefighters guide Philip toward the dining room. The space is filled with gardeners drifting about in various different uniforms: local horticulturists, national botanists, and incognito researchers. The first gardener is guiding Philip to a bench where a yellow-coated technician is assembling a measuring tape and quiz cards. The dialogue is calm, slow-paced, and spaced out. Miles has grabbed Philip's left foot and is rotating its toes onto the measuring tape, but Philip yanks his foot away. Two women in flashy dresses are departing as Philip gives his foot forward and lowers his voice at an invisible whistler. Philip is calming down and he flings the raincoat being exhibited by Teacher #2. Philip notices that he's gotten paint from his toe-drawing all over the coat and gently nudges it. Throughout the monologue, Philip circles the space, relaxing into a calm, gently placing tea kettles onto saucers, generally tidying up, complimenting the gardeners, and flicking their hands off his decorations. Specifically, it is the tunnel in the dusty patch of sand that Jack and Earl slid into. We are zooming back to disclose the hands—the glossy red leather gloves and green jacket sleeves—becoming rapidly splattered—of several gardeners drifting about the tunnel, while golden retrievers sniff around. With a cheer, bicycle pedals enter the scene, and the bike's sandal-wearing rider peacefully circles the tunnel once; gardeners shuffle back, and dogs scamper away to give him space. He moves toward the lens and pauses, sitting beside the bike, while the drum-beating rider tune echoes up. The rider nods his head; he doesn't think they moved that way. Instantly, with a soft drumbeat sound, the rider's head tilts to the side as he observes across the park, motionless, having tasted, breathed, or sensed something. The dogs drifting around the tunnel also respond, tilting to attention a brief moment after the rider, as a fox is sprinting away at the distant edge of the park. After a moment, their focus returns to the tunnel, and his focus also returns to the task at hand as he peers, concentrating. His bike whispers. It is the closet where we previously noticed Jack and Earl polishing their shoes, now vacant. The closet is silent except for the ticking clock and the faint whisper of an arriving bicycle, which grows stronger, then starts to fade as the bike whizzes past the station. Quickly, we detect the screech of the bike's wheels, and we are on the path outside the bus stop as the bicycle skids to a pause in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A policeman guides Nathan back into a house filled with local police, state troopers, and plainclothes detectives. As Nathan undergoes fingerprinting by a technician, he becomes agitated, spreading ink on an overcoat and kicking it in frustration. Nathan, increasingly frenzied, paces the room, tidying up, scolding officers, and moving their feet off his furniture. Meanwhile, outside, policemen and dogs examine a muddy hole from which Gale and Evelle emerged. A motorcyclist arrives, surveying the scene before focusing on a jackrabbit bounding away, momentarily diverting attention from the hole. The scene shifts to an empty bathroom previously used by Gale and Evelle, as the sound of the motorcycle fades and then screeches to a halt outside a gas station.
